content.summary: This document outlines the procedures for serving legal documents such as process, pleadings, or other papers on non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents. It specifies how these documents can be served through appointed agents and the role of the Commission's Secretary in forwarding these documents. It also provides definitions for terms like 'Managing agent', 'Non-resident', and 'Principal office and place of business'.

elements.title: Serving non-resident investment advisers
elements.statement: A person may serve process, pleadings, or other papers on a non-resident investment adviser, or on a non-resident general partner or non-resident managing agent of an investment adviser by serving any or all of its appointed agents.

terms.reason: The term is a general reference to an individual or entity.

elements.title: Forwarding documents by the Secretary
elements.statement: If process, pleadings, or other papers are served on the Commission as described in this section, the Secretary of the Commission (Secretary) will promptly forward a copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.

elements.title: Certification of service by the Secretary
elements.statement: If the Secretary certifies that the Commission was served with process, pleadings, or other papers pursuant to paragraph (a)(1) of this section and forwarded these documents to a named party pursuant to paragraph (a)(2) of this section, this certification constitutes evidence of service upon that party.

elements.title: Definition of Managing agent
elements.statement: Managing agent means any person, including a trustee, who directs or manages, or who participates in directing or managing, the affairs of any unincorporated organization or association other than a partnership.

elements.title: Definition of Non-resident
elements.statement: Non-resident means an individual who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States; a corporation that is incorporated in or that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States; and a partnership or other unincorporated organization or association that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

elements.statement: Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

function.name: ElementsDocumentModel

content.summary: This document outlines the procedure for proceedings initiated by the filing of an application or by the Commission's own motion under any section of the Act or related rules. It details the publication of notice, submission of facts by interested persons, issuance of orders, and conditions for ordering a hearing. It also defines 'application' for the purposes of this rule.

elements.title: Notice of initiation of proceeding
elements.statement: Notice of the initiation of the proceeding will be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.

terms.reason: The term is a general concept related to communication.

The verb phrase describes the action of indicating the date.
elements.reason: The statement describes a general procedure that is followed, fitting the definition of a fact type.

elements.title: Submission of facts by interested persons
elements.statement: Any interested person may, within the period of time specified therein, submit to the Commission in writing any facts bearing upon the desirability of a hearing on the matter and may request that a hearing be held, stating his reasons therefor and the nature of his interest in the matter.

terms.reason: The term refers to a general category of individuals involved in the process.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a participant in the process.

elements.title: Issuance of order disposing of the matter
elements.statement: An order disposing of the matter will be issued as of course following the expiration of the period of time referred to in paragraph (a) of this section, unless the Commission thereafter orders a hearing on the matter.

terms.reason: The term refers to a legal directive.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key outcome of the proceeding.

terms.reason: The term refers to the subject of the proceeding.

elements.title: Commission orders a hearing
elements.statement: The Commission will order a hearing on the matter, if it appears that a hearing is necessary or appropriate in the public interest or for the protection of investors.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific governing body.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as the authority ordering the hearing.

elements.title: Definition of application
elements.statement: For purposes of this rule, an “application” means any application for an order of the Commission under the Act other than an application for registration as an investment adviser.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal request.

function.name: ElementsDocumentModel

content.summary: This document defines what constitutes a 'small business' or 'small organization' under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 for the purposes of the Regulatory Flexibility Act. It specifies criteria related to assets under management, total assets, and control relationships to determine if an investment adviser qualifies as a small entity. It also provides definitions for 'control' and 'total assets' in this context.

elements.title: Definition of small business or small organization
elements.statement: The term small business or small organization for purposes of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 shall mean an investment adviser that has assets under management of less than $25 million, did not have total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year, and does not control, is not controlled by, and is not under common control with another investment adviser that has assets under management of $25 million or more, or any person that had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.

elements.title: Control definition for corporations
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a corporation if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities or has the power to sell or direct the sale of 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities.

terms.reason: The term is used to refer to entities with control capabilities.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term is a type of entity that can be controlled.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to a type of security that grants voting rights.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

The verb indicates possession of voting rights.
The verb indicates possession of power.
The verb indicates an action related to control.
elements.reason: The statement provides a general condition under which control is presumed.

elements.title: Control definition for partnerships
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a partnership if the person has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the partnership.

terms.reason: The term is used to refer to entities with control capabilities.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

The verb indicates a right related to dissolution.
The verb indicates an action related to contribution.
elements.reason: The statement provides a general condition under which control is presumed.

elements.title: Control definition for limited liability companies
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a limited liability company if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the interests of the LLC, has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the LLC, or is an elected manager of the LLC.

terms.reason: The term is used to refer to entities with control capabilities.

elements.title: Control definition for trusts
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a trust if the person is a trustee or managing agent of the trust.

elements.title: Definition of total assets
elements.statement: Total assets means the total assets as shown on the balance sheet of the investment adviser or other person described above under paragraph (a)(3) of this section, or the balance sheet of the investment adviser or such other person with its subsidiaries consolidated, whichever is larger.
